SuChe

GET IN TOUCH

Year

2014

Location

Pune,IN / London,UK

Tags

User Research, IxD, User Experience

Drug Discovery

A global publishing company for their drug discovery database, wanted to create a intuitive search experience for users. A search experience that would empower a varied set of users with the much needed information.

Problem

The drug database was used by scientists, researchers, drug regulatory personnel, venture capitalists and students, The search should cater to the needs of the different user types who have varied levels of expertise in the field.

It was required to take into account every user typesâ€™ search preferences, their behavior, sources of information, nature of work and the situation of use.

Process

We started attending pharmaceutical conferences and talking with the attendees and also visited pharmaceutical companies in the US and Europe, meeting and talking with scientists. We also hopped into academic institutions to interact with academic research user types who would be using the new database.

Research & Analysis

Contextual inquiries were used as the primary research methodology. We also created quick prototypes of the search interactions and user tested them with the users by giving them tasks to complete. The research output collected was analysed to arrive at actionable insights and state the design principle.

Design Principle

Whether the users prefer to search or to browse by starting with a broad search term, they need to arrive onto the desired results across different content sets over drugs, deals, trials and patents.

If they knew exactly what they wanted, they need to be directed by a set of parameters to land onto a small set of results to narrow down to the perfect drug candidate.

Simple Search

Our understanding of search evolved over multiple rounds of research and user testing. We go to know that the users structure the search in their minds before they would actually search.

A straight forward free text search did not work for them. We designed a simple search with the most used structures of search.

Advanced Search

Advanced search was designed with the query growing as it's being built by the users. The quick result count was found to be super useful for the users.

Hierarchy Search

For the expert users, we created a hierarchy search experience to enable them to explore drug information for broader set of parameters that belonged to a family or hierarchy.

Wireframes

The search experience was designed to help each user type reach to the drug information based on their nature of work and expertise.

Outcome

There was a significant rise in the number of subscriptions for the database and the users found the new search to be user friendly to use.
